etymology.description: 甜(sweet) + 菜(vegetable/edible plant) = beet/sugar beet.
etymology.interpretation: Literally “sweet vegetable,” naming the beet—especially the sugar beet—because of its high sugar content; in food contexts it can also refer to beetroot (often 甜菜根/紅甜菜).

examples.chinese: 甜菜主要用来制糖(甜菜主要用來製糖)，在北方种植广泛(在北方種植廣泛)。
examples.pinyin: Tiáncài zhǔyào yònglái zhìtáng, zài Běifāng zhòngzhí guǎngfàn.
examples.english: Beets (especially sugar beets) are mainly used for sugar production and are widely cultivated in the north.

examples.chinese: 我们把甜菜根切片做沙拉(我們把甜菜根切片做沙拉)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen bǎ tiáncài gēn qiēpiàn zuò shālā.
examples.english: We slice beetroot to make a salad.

examples.chinese: 红甜菜颜色鲜红(紅甜菜顏色鮮紅)，味道微甜(味道微甜)。
examples.pinyin: Hóng tiáncài yánsè xiānhóng, wèidào wēitián.
examples.english: Red beets are bright red and mildly sweet.
